alert.note: Alert for Bath; Clay; Elliott; Estill; Fleming; Jackson; Menifee; Montgomery; Morgan; Owsley; Powell; Rockcastle; Rowan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 9:39PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Montgomery, Owsley, Jackson, Menifee, Lee, southeastern Fleming, Rowan, Wolfe, Powell, Morgan, Bath, Estill, northern Rockcastle, northwestern Breathitt, northwestern Magoffin, north central Clay and Elliott Counties through 1030 PM EDT... At 938 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Bluestone to Fagan to near Hardwick to Disputanta. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Morehead, Frenchburg, Campsites in the Indian Creek area of the Daniel Boone National Forrest, Clearfield, Brandy, Tabor, Fagan, Rodburn, Bluestone and Freestone around 945 PM EDT. Crix, Mariba, Pelfrey, Christy, Lick Fork, Red River Gorge, Gates, Paragon, Hisel and Ratlitt around 950 PM EDT. Patsey, Pomeroyton, Hamm, See, Denniston, Pilot, Crystal, Vale, Craney and Rogers Chapel around 955 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Wellington, Wagner, Minor, Stoll, Fixer, Standing Rock, Leeco, Hurley, Waneta, Greeley, Beattyville, McKee, Zoe, Lytten, Bradshaw, Whisman, Fannin Valley, Zachariah, Maytown, Ezel, Henry, Fincastle, Mize, Booth, Gray Hawk, Rexville, Pekin, Grannie, Murphyfork, Little Sandy, Sandy Hook, Campton, Demund, Nickell, Mummie, Lizzielane, Flat, Privett, Grassy Creek, Williba, West Liberty, Elian, Green Hall, Stacy Fork, Isonville, Mary, Panama, Lane, Payton and Nathanton. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 13 and 67. Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 109 and 148. Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 66 and 72. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If on or near Cave Run Lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.

area.areaDesc: Bath; Clay; Elliott; Estill; Fleming; Jackson; Menifee; Montgomery; Morgan; Owsley; Powell; Rockcastle; Rowan
